body.name: Catacombs of Time: A Dark Epic Fantasy Adventure Novella (Sword and Sorcery Book 2)
body.description: “Dylan Doose is a master.”—Amazon reviewerThis edition includes a FREE bonus short story—I Remember My First Time.It’s going to be a long and bloody night.The clock is ticking and Dr. De’Brouillard has a date. Dinner is at the Graves and a contract to cure one of the cursed is sitting on the plate. But when an old and dear friend reaches out from murky shadow for a helping hand, will the Doctor take it, risking all if he ends up being late?New heroes join the fray. Are they friend or foe?Dr. Gaige De’Brouillard believes science, not magic, conquers all. Even death is just an equation to be solved. Malory “Butcher” Dahmer knows that life is but a dream, no wickedness, no sorcery too strange or obscene. An Academic and a Gangster make for an interesting team.Don’t miss the dark fantasy that reviewers are calling ‘visceral,’ ‘fantastic,’ and ‘intriguing’—get your copy of Catacombs of Time today!Read all the books in the dark and gritty Sword and Sorcery Series!Fire and Sword (Volume 1)Catacombs of Time (Volume 2)I Remember My First Time (short story)The Pyres (Volume 3)Ice and Stone (Volume 4)As They Burn (Volume 5)Black Sun Moon (Volume 6)Embers On The Wind (Volume 7)Graves of the Gods (Volume 8)The Beast of Strubore (Short story available only for VIP Reader Group Subscribers. Subscribe now! www.DylanDooseAuthor.com)Sword and Sorcery Box Set 1 (books 1-3)Sword and Sorcery Box Set 2 (books 4-6)Sword and Sorcery Box Set 3 (books 7-8) Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hooked from the 1st paragraph.
reviews.reviewText: Rarely does a book come along that traps me. The writing is picturesque. I'm in the book watching as it unfolds. I'll be reading more Dylan Doose. Eagerly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good short read
reviews.reviewText: I don't normally read novellas because I like a good long story. Considering this was the second book in a series I had no choice. I'm hoping this story plays out in book three.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I stumbled into Dylan Doose
reviews.reviewText: Dylan Doose is a master. Who is he? Where has he been? He's a painter of darkness. Yet, there are rays of light. His words affect my dreams. He writes with the wideness of great poetry. My inner man, whatever the hell that is, has somehow awakened. I feel it. There is a pulse where there was no pulse before. Dylan's imagery moves me. I'm not easily moved. I'm not drawn to the darkness but more aware of it now. It surrounds us. Dylan delves into and exposes a spiritual reality that few can convey. I pray that he doesn't lose his mind. I want him around for a long, long time. What must his mama have been thinking watching him grow up!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not as Good as "Sword & Sorcery"
reviews.reviewText: I normally am not thrilled with these themes, but the author thrilled with the first book in this series. So after failing to find another book as gripping or as well written in my e-library, I bought this book. Regretfully, he did not do the same with this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy It! You won't be disappointed! It's fantastic!
reviews.reviewText: I loved this little novella it has all the makings of a full novel and I would definitely buy it as such, and any sequels as well. The characters are perfectly rounded and have such depth. The locations are described beautifully and make you feel as if you are a fly on the wall looking down on what is playing out below. Mr. Doose you have a gift!! Thank you so much for sharing it with us and please share some more soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2017
reviews.reviewText: Been looking for something new in fantasy and so far D. Doose has been hitting all the marks. I look forward to reading more about this dark world he has created.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2017
reviews.reviewText: A great mixture of sword magic and fantasy mixed in to a great cauldron of great characters and stunning backdrops make this a great read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not really related to the first book
reviews.reviewText: I didn’t realize the all the books in the series were not directly connected. I thought I was buying the second book that would be picking up where the first book ended. But it’s a totally new set of characters and as far as I can tell 300 years in the future. I am having a very hard time getting into this book and unfortunately can’t seem to return an ebook.
Definitely not enough entertainment for 3 EUR.It is a well written book but I could give you the whole content in 2 or 3 sentences. There is not much content for your money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick read but good tie in
reviews.reviewText: It was shorter than i would have liked, but it was very enjoyable and an exciting tie into the next book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 22, 2017
reviews.reviewText: A gripping read in a beautifully dark world. Fully realised characters, attention-grabbing story and interestung world. An amazing work for such a short book. I'll definitely be picking up more by Dylan Doose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 29, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: The word-use is excellently contextual, I particularly liked the characterisation in this and your other works and the internal
reviews.reviewText: I disliked the fact that 'catacombs' is so short, a full length book would have done the story and your talent full justice.I would recommend your work to anyone

reviews.reviewTitle: This book was an amazing amount of fun to read
reviews.reviewText: This book was an amazing amount of fun to read, and it is a must read for anyone who loves the Fantasy genre!
